comment.author: 11814739@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Whaling ⇂, and we'd love to have this added to the group! as it was likely built to guide whaling ships.

comment.author: 22220738@N07
comment._content: Cape Saunders was named by Captain James Cook on 17 January 1775 whilst on his second voyage of discovery. It is thought that Cook names the cape after Admiral Sir Charles Saunders (1713-1775), under whom Cook had served earlier in his career.
